llm.feedback: The draft mixes up the required 4‑line “Up/Down” format, adds an unnecessary “Short” line, and omits the mandatory swing‑trade/outlook line. Re‑structure it to exactly 4 lines, each strictly: **Up/Down | Time window | Driver/Mechanism | What to watch | Probability %**. Use the canonical handle **ust10y** and cite the relevant IDs (97MD1FHW8, 3YAQ8JUPL, 1DEM6P1Y2). Replace “0‑3 weeks” with the precise catalyst window (e.g., “Sep 16‑17 FOMC” or “Aug 30 PCE”). Remove the “Post‑cut” line (not a time window) and the “Short” line entirely. After the 4 lines, add a concise swing‑trade line for **ust10y**: e.g., **Up | 0‑3 weeks | Fed dovish rhetoric + sticky core PCE + tariff persistence → 10‑20 bps climb | Fed minutes, July PCE, tariff policy | 70 % | 80** (confidence). Include entry (4.23 %), stop (4.10 %), target (4.35 %), R/R (1.5), invalidation (Fed hike >25 bp or core PCE >2.9 %), and trigger (Fed minutes, July PCE, tariff policy). Ensure every claim is backed by an ID citation and that the probability reflects the evidence (e.g., 89 % for a cut, 70 % for a rise). Remove any drift or generic statements that do not tie back to **ust10y**.
